channel.title: Accessing Data :: Java Web Development
channel.description: Now that we have connected our Java application to a MySQL database, we need to set up our Java classes and interfaces. In the previous lessons, we learned about performing CRUD operations on a database and its tables. One of the reasons we use ORM is so that now we can write Java code in our application to manage our relational database. Persistent Classes Our JPA needs to know what Java class is going to be converted to a table in the MySQL database.
